weeks of gestation. The gestational age (in weeks) corresponds to the fundal height (in cm) after 24 weeks of 
gestation. The normal fundal height is different at different weeks of pregnancy. Follow the following steps for 
measuring fundal height
 ∙ Divide the abdomen into parts by imaginary lines to estimate the gestational age through the fundal height.
 ∙ The most important line is the one passing through the umbilicus.
